intro: Pycreus bipartitus, commonly known as the two-parted pycreus, is a rare and enigmatic member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a delicate, lacey appearance. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late summer, adding a subtle ornamental value. It is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
